title: Dietary Needs & Restaurant Etiquette
objectives: Ask for less spice, less salt, or substitutions
Use polite apologies and thanks in restaurants
context: Staff appreciate clear, polite requests about spice level or allergies.
Korean dishes are often shared; learn how to speak up kindly.
Short set phrases handle most needs without long grammar.

sentences.english: Do you have something not spicy?
Please make it a little less spicy.
I'm vegetarian. Please leave out the meat.
Thank you. Enjoy your meal (response to staff).

explanation: 덜/더 + adjective turns into 'less/more': 덜 맵게, 더 맵게. Add 조금 for extra softness: 조금 덜 맵게 해 주세요.
짠 음식 is salty food. Say 짜지 않게 해 주세요 = Please make it not too salty.
For allergies, be direct: 저는 땅콩 알레르기가 있어요 (I have a peanut allergy). Follow with 못 먹어요 (I can't eat it).
채식주의자예요 (I'm vegetarian) / 비건이에요 (I'm vegan). Ask '고기 들어가요?' = Does this have meat?
맛있게 드세요 is a polite 'enjoy' used by staff or to others. You respond with 잘 먹겠습니다 before eating in formal settings.
